subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The sound of rejoicing in Jerusalem could be heard far away. (Nehemiah 12:43)
reflection: The praises that were heard were the result of God's help overcoming the opposition of enemies like Sanballat and the rebuilding of the wall. What has God given us that should cause our praises to overflow into praise? IS IT GOD'S DIRECTION IN OUR LIFE? IS IT THE COMFORT HE ALONE CAN PROVIDE IN THE TIME OF TROUBLE? OR IS IT OUR ULTIMATE GIFT OF SALVATION?
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The sound of rejoicing in Jerusalem could be_

_heard far away._ (Neh. 12:43)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The praises that were heard were the result of God's

help overcoming the opposition of enemies like

Sanballat and the rebuilding of the wall. What has

God given us that should cause our praises to overflow into praise?

IS IT GOD'S DIRECTION IN OUR LIFE? IS IT THE COMFORT

HE ALONE CAN PROVIDE IN THE TIME OF TROUBLE? OR

IS IT OUR ULTIMATE GIFT OF SALVATION?

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Joseph -- whom the apostles called Barnabas (which means "son of encouragement" Sold a field he owned and brought the money and put it at the feet of the apostles. (Acts 4:36, 37)
reflection: The generosity and support of Barnabas demonstrates what it means to be a son or daughter of encouragement. HAVE YOU DECIDED HOW YOU CAN BE AN ENCOURAGE TO SOMEONE IN THE COMING YEAR?
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Joseph -- whom the apostles called Barnabas_ (which means
"son of encouragement" _Sold a field he owned and brought_

_the money and put it at the feet of the apostles. _(Acts 4:36, 37)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The generosity and support of Barnabas demonstrates what it

means to be a son or daughter of encouragement.

HAVE YOU DECIDED HOW YOU CAN BE AN ENCOURAGER TO

SOME-ONE IN THE COMING YEAR?

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Wounds from a friend can be trusted. (Proverbs 27:6)
reflection: Solomon honored such friendship in his proverbs. Jesus went further-- He endured the wounds of our rejection not only to tell us the truth about ourselves but to show us how much we are loved. WHAT KIND OF FRIEND ARE YOU? DO YOU SHARE THE TRUTH WITH YOUR NEIGHBOR IN LOVE?
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Wounds from a friend can be trusted. _(Pro. 27:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon honored such friendship in his proverbs.
Jesus went further-- He endured the wounds of our

rejection not only to tell us the truth about ourselves

but to show us how much we are loved.

WHAT KIND OF FRIEND ARE YOU? DO YOU SHARE THE

TRUTH WITH YOUR NEIGHBOR IN LOVE?

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The earnest prayer of a righteous person has great power and produces wonderful results. (James 5:16)
reflection: God often chooses to move through our prayers to accomplish His work. God wants us to join Him in His work through humble, persistent prayers. When we make it our aim to serve God through praying faithfully, we are taking part in a beautiful privilege where at any moment we may be given the privilege of being a part of a miracle. GREAT FAITH ON OUR PART HONORS GOD.
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 11:

_The earnest prayer of a righteous person has great _

_power and produces wonderful results. _(Jm. 5:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God often chooses to move through our prayers to

accomplish His work. God wants us to join Him in

His work through humble, persistent prayers. When

we make it our aim to serve God through praying

faithfully, we are taking part in a beautiful privilege

where at any moment we may be given the privilege

of being a part of a miracle.

GREAT FAITH ON OUR PART HONORS GOD.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You cannot serve both God and money. (Matthew 6:24)
reflection: Jesus devoted a substantial section of His Sermon on the Mount to money and the fondness of it. He taught us to pray NOT for an accumulation of riches but for "Our daily bread" (Matthew 6:11) Yes He warned against storing up treasures on earth. TRUE, MONEY MATTERS. BUT MONEY SHOULDN'T RULE OUR DECISION-MAKING PROCESS. TOUGH TIMES AND BIG DECISIONS ARE OPPORTUNITIES TO GROW OUR FAITH IN NEW WAYS. BUT NEVER FORGET OUR HEAVENLY FATHER LOVE AND CARES FOR US.
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 12:

_You cannot serve both God and money. _(Mt. 6:24)

THOUGHT FOR DEC. 12:

Jesus devoted a substantial section of His Sermon on the

Mount to money and the fondness of it. He taught us to pray

NOT for an accumulation of riches but for _"Our daily bread"_

(Mt. 6:11) Yes He warned against storing up treasures on

earth.

TRUE, MONEY MATTERS. BUT MONEY SHOULDN'T RULE OUR

DECISION-MAKING PROCESS. TOUGH TIMES AND BIG DECISIONS

ARE OPPORTUNITIES TO GROW OUR FAITH IN NEW WAYS. BUT

NEVER FORGET OUR HEAVENLY FATHER LOVE AND CARES FOR US.

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Look there, on the mountain, the feet of the one who proclaims peace. (Nahum 1:15)
reflection: Nahum and Isaiah's prophetic words of hope found their ultimate fulfillment at the first Christmas when the angel told the shepherds, "Do not be afraid, I bring you good- news that will cause great joy for all people. 'Today in the town of David a Savior has been born to you; He is the Messiah, the Lord. " (Luke 2:10-12) THE MOST IMPORTANT HEADLINE IN OUR LIVES EVERY DAY IS THE VERY BEST NEWS EVER SPOKEN-CHRIST THE SAVIOR IS BORN.
original_content:

_Look there, on the mountain, the feet of the one who_

_who proclaims peace. _(Nah 1:15)

told the shepherds, _"Do not be afraid, I bring you good-_

_ news that will cause great joy for all people. 'Today in_

_the town of David a Savior has been born to you; He is_

_the Messiah, the Lord." _(Lk. 2:10-12)

THE MOST IMPORTANT HEADLINE IN OUR LIVES EVERY DAY

IS THE VERY BEST NEWS EVER SPOKEN-CHRIST THE SAVIOR

IS BORN.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The darkness is passing and the true light is already shinning. (I John 2:8)
reflection: The apostle John wrote these words to believers as an encouragement. He went on to say, "Anyone who loves their brother and sister lives in the light, and there is nothing in them to make them stumble. " (vs. 10). By contrast, he equated hating people with roaming around in darkness. Hatred is disorienting; it takes away our sense of moral direction. WHEN WE CHOOSE LOVE INSTEAD OF HATE, WE ARE SHOWING OUR RELATIONSHIP TO CHRIST AND REFLECTING HIS RADIANCE TO THE WORLD AROUND US. GOD IS LIGHT.
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 14:

_The darkness is passing and the true light_

_is already shinning. _(I Jn. 2:8)

THE THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The apostle John wrote these words to believers as an

contrast, he equated hating people with roaming around

in darkness. Hatred is disorienting; it takes away our

sense of moral direction.

WHEN WE CHOOSE LOVE INSTEAD OF HATE, WE ARE SHOWING

OUR RELATIONSHIP TO CHRIST AND REFLECTING HIS RADIANCE

TO THE WORLD AROUND US. GOD IS LIGHT.

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We are confident, I say, and would prefer to be away from the body and at home with the Lord. (2 Thessalonians 5:8)
reflection: Many of us will pass into heaven through death but for some that thought causes great anxiety. Some worry that the process of dying will be to difficult to bear. But with the assurance of Jesus as our Savior we can rest in the confidence that when we close our eyes on earth and pass through death, we will open our eyes in God's presence. AS WE LOOK FORWARD TO SEEING JESUS IN HEAVEN IT WILL BE OUR GREATEST JOY.
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 15:

_We are confident, I say, and would prefer to be away_

_from the body and at home with the Lord. _(2 Thess. 5:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Many of us will pass into heaven through death but for some

that thought causes great anxiety. Some worry that the process

of dying will be to difficult to bear. But with the assurance of

Jesus as our Savior we can rest in the confidence that when we

close our eyes on earth and pass through death, we will open our

eyes in God's presence.

AS WE LOOK FORWARD TO SEEING JESUS IN HEAVEN IT WILL BE OUR

GREATEST JOY.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Hear the Word of the Lord. (Jeremiah 7:2)
reflection: This speaker's brand of "Comfort my People" was another side of God's comfort. Like a bitter herb that heals malaria, His words were spiritually curative. When we hear hard words, instead of walking away, may we respond to their healing effects. GOD'S CORRECTION IS NEVER TO HARM US BUT ONLY TO HEAL US. GOD'S DISCIPLINE IS DESIGNED TO MAKE US LIKE HIS SON.
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 16:

_Hear the Word of the Lord. _(Jer. 7:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This speaker's brand of _"Comfort my People"_ was another

side of God's comfort. Like a bitter herb that heals malaria,

His words were spiritually curative. When we hear hard words,

instead of walking away, may we respond to their healing effects.

GOD'S CORRECTION IS NEVER TO HARM US BUT ONLY TO HEAL US.

GOD'S DISCIPLINE IS DESIGNED TO MAKE US LIKE HIS SON.

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Blessed is the one whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered. (Psalm 32:1)
reflection: When Jesus came to this world, John the Baptist called Him "the Lamb of God that takes away the sin of the world. " (John 1:29). We need our sins taken care of because it separates us from God whose character and ways are always perfect and right. Being right with God is a gift from Him. Jesus, the Lamb, is God's way to cover us. THE ONLY PERMANENT COVERING FOR SIN IS THE BLOOD OF CHRIST.
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 17:

_Blessed is the one whose transgressions are forgiven,_

_whose sins are covered. _(Ps. 32:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_When Jesus came to this world, John the Baptist called_

_Him "the Lamb of God that takes away the sin of the _

_world_." (Jn. 1:29)._ __We need our sins taken care of because _

_it separates us from God whose character and ways are_

_always perfect and right. Being right with God is a gift_

_from Him. Jesus, the Lamb, is God's way to cover us._

THE ONLY PERMANENT COVERING FOR SIN IS THE BLOOD OF CHRIST.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The disciples were asked "Who do you say I am?" (Matthew 16:15)
reflection: How can anyone read the Gospel's and not feel the actual presence of Jesus? If you have not discovered this feeling, let me assure you that eventually YOU WILL have to answer the question, "Who do you say Jesus is?" WHY? Because-THE IDENTITY OF JESUS IS THE CENTRAL QUESTION OF ETERNITY.
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 18:

The disciples were asked "_Who do you say I am__?" _(Mt 16:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

How can anyone read the Gospel's and not feel the actual

presence of Jesus? If you have not discovered this feeling,

let me assure you that eventually YOU WILL have to answer

the question, _"Who do you say Jesus is?"_

WHY? Because-THE IDENTITY OF JESUS IS THE CENTRAL QUESTION OF ETERNITY.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Do you think you deserve credit merely for loving those who love you? Even sinners do that! (Luke 6:32)
reflection: Love means action. One way to put love to work is to take the initiative in meeting special needs. This is easy to do with people who love us, people whom we trust, BUT love means doing this EVEN to people who dislike us or hurt us. GIVE AS THOUGH YOU ARE GIVING TO GOD!
original_content:
THE VERSE FOR DEC. 19

_Do you think you deserve credit merely for loving those who_

_love you? Even sinners do that! _(Lk. 6:32)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY?

Love means action. One way to put love to work is to take the

initiative in meeting special needs. This is easy to do with people

who love us, people whom we trust, BUT love means doing this

EVEN to people who dislike us or hurt us.

GIVE AS THOUGH YOU ARE GIVING TO GOD!

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The angel said to the, "Do not be afraid, I bring you good news that will cause great joy for all people." (Luke 2:10)
reflection: The gospel of Luke tells us that God sent an angle to ordinary shepherds to deliver an extraordinary birth announcement. Since then this message has been spread through the centuries to us, AND NOW we are Christ's messengers of joy to the world. THROUGH the indwelling of the Holy Spirit, we continue the practice of spreading the joy of Jesus as we follow His example and serve others. LET US TAKE THE JOY OF CHRISTMAS WITH US EVERY DAY!
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 20

_The angel said to the, "Do not be afraid, I bring you good _

_news that will cause great joy for all people." _(Lk. 2:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The gospel of Luke tells us that God sent an angle to ordinary

shepherds to deliver an extraordinary birth announcement.

Since then this message has been spread through the centuries

to us, AND NOW we are Christ's messengers of joy to the world.

THROUGH the indwelling of the Holy Spirit, we continue the

practice of spreading the joy of Jesus as we follow His example

and serve others.

LET US TAKE THE JOY OF CHRISTMAS WITH US EVERY DAY!

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Even if my Father and mother abandon me, the Lord will hold me close. (Psalm 27:10)
reflection: Many have had the sad experience of be abandoned by father and mother. Broken homes, difference in belief. addiction to drugs or alcohol, even psychological isolation can leave children crippled by this loss. Even as adults, the pain may linger. GOD CAN TAKE THAT PLACE IN OUR LIFE, FILL THAT VOID, AND HEAL THAT HURT.
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 21:

_Even if my Father and mother abandon me,_

_the Lord will hold me close. _(Ps. 27:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Many have had the sad experience of be abandoned by

father and mother. Broken homes, difference in belief.

addiction to drugs or alcohol, even psychological isolation

can leave children crippled by this loss. Even as adults,

the pain may linger.

GOD CAN TAKE THAT PLACE IN OUR LIFE, FILL THAT VOID, AND

HEAL THAT HURT.

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. (I Peter 3:15)
reflection: Some Christians believe that faith is a personal matter that should be kept to oneself. It is true we shouldn't be boisterous or obnoxious in sharing our faith, but we should always be ready to give an answer, gently and respectfully, when asked about our faith, our lifestyle, or our Christian perspective. ARE YOU PREPARED TO TELL OTHERS WHAT CHRIST HAS DONE IN YOUR LIFE?
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 22:

_Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who_

_asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have._

(I Pet. 3:15)

THE THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Some Christians believe that faith is a personal matter that

should be kept to oneself. It is true we shouldn't be boisterous

or obnoxious in sharing our faith, but we should always be

ready to give an answer, gently and respectfully, when asked

about our faith, our lifestyle, or our Christian perspective.

ARE YOU PREPARED TO TELL OTHERS WHAT CHRIST HAS DONE IN

YOUR LIFE?

_ PASTOR AL__ _

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not all His benefits. (Psalm 103:2)
reflection: The most important gift we can ever receive is God's gift of His Son, our Savior, and with Him forgiveness, restoration, and the promise of eternal life that begins now and lasts forever. And the most important gift we can give is to give Jesus our heart. IF WE WERE A WISE MEN, WE WOULD DO OUR PART. YET WHAT CAN WE GIVE HIM---LETS GIVE HIM OUR HEART.
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 23:

_Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not all His_

_benefits_. (Ps. 103:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The most important gift we can ever receive is God's gift of

His Son, our Savior, and with Him forgiveness, restoration,

and the promise of eternal life that begins now and lasts forever.

And the most important gift we can give is to give Jesus our heart.

IF WE WERE A WISE MEN, WE WOULD DO OUR PART. YET WHAT CAN WE

GIVE HIM---LETS GIVE HIM OUR HEART.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: On those living in the land of deep darkness a light has dawned. (Isaiah 9:2)
reflection: Out of the brilliance that surround the shepherds a shinning ray fell into our darkness. So this Christmas let us embrace the Good News that God, in Christ, HAS bridged the gap between us. NO MATTER WHERE TODAY FINDS US, JESUS HAS PENETRATED OUR DARK WORLD WITH HIS JOY AND LIGHT.

NO MATTER WHERE TODAY FINDS US, JESUS HAS PENETRATED

OUR DARK WORLD WITH HIS JOY AND LIGHT.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Do not be afraid. I bring you good news that will cause great joy for all the people. (Luke 2:10)
reflection: The joy was not for a few people, but for all people. "For God so loved the whole world that He gave His one and only Son. " (John 3:16) As we share the lifechanging message of Jesus with others, we need to join the worldwide chorus in proclaiming, "The glories of His righteousness and the wonders of His love. " THE GOOD NEWS OF JESUS'S BIRTH IS A SOURCE OF JOY FOR ALL PEOPLE.
original_content:

join the worldwide chorus in proclaiming, "The glories

of His righteousness and the wonders of His love."

THE GOOD NEWS OF JESUS'S BIRTH IS A SOURCE OF JOY FOR

ALL PEOPLE.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When the set time had fully come, God sent His Son. (Galatians 4:4)
reflection: When we become discouraged because God doesn't respond according to our time table. Christmas reminds us that "when the set time had fully come, God sent His Son. that we might receive adoption to sonship: (Galatians 4:4-5) GOD'S TIMING IS ALWAYS RIGHT, LET US REMEMBER TO PRAY FOR PATIENCE!
original_content:

_When the set time had fully come, God sent His Son._

When we become discouraged because God doesn't respond

might receive adoption to sonship: (Gal. 4:4-5)

GOD'S TIMING IS ALWAYS RIGHT, LET US REMEMBER TO

PRAY FOR PATIENCE!

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We did not follow cleverly devised stories when we told you about the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ in power, but we were eyewitnesses of His majesty. (2 Peter 1:16)
reflection: The Bible is not a collection of fables or human ideas about God. It is God's very words given through people to people. Peter emphasized his authority as an eyewitness as well as the God inspired authority of Scripture to prepare the way for his harsh words against false teachers. OUR FAITH MUST GO BEYOND WHAT WE BELIEVE, IT MUST BECOME A PART OF ALL WE DO
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 27:

_We did not follow cleverly devised stories when we told _

_but we were eyewitnesses of His majesty. _(2 Pet. 1:16)

The Bible is not a collection of fables or human ideas about

Peter emphasized his authority as an eyewitness as well as the

God inspired authority of Scripture to prepare the way for his

harsh words against false teachers.

OUR FAITH MUST GO BEYOND WHAT WE BELIEVE, IT MUST BECOME

A PART OF ALL WE DO

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good; His love endures forever. (Psalm 106:1)
reflection: The promises of the unfailing and everlasting nature of God's love are found throughout Scripture. And the greatest proof of His love is the death of His Son so that those who put their faith in Him can live eternally. FELLOW BELIEVERS, WE ARE LOCKED INTO GOD'S LOVE FOREVER!

greatest proof of His love is the death of His Son so

that those who put their faith in Him can live eternally.

FELLOW BELIEVERS, WE ARE LOCKED INTO GOD'S LOVE FOREVER!

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I will make you like My signet ring, for I have chosen you, declares the Lord. (Haggai 2:23)
reflection: In ancient times, the signet ring was used as a means of identification. Instead of signing their name, People would press their ring into hot wax or soft clay to make their mark. As God's children, we make our mark on the world as we spread the gospel, share His grace through loving our neighbors, and work to end oppression. EACH OF US HAVE OUR OWN UNIQUE STAMP THAT REVEALS HOW WE'RE CREATED IN GOD'S IMAGE.
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 29:

_I will make you like My signet ring, for I have chosen you,_

_declares the Lord. _(Haggai 2:23)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In ancient times, the signet ring was used as a means of

identification. Instead of signing their name, People would

press their ring into hot wax or soft clay to make their mark.

As God's children, we make our mark on the world as we

spread the gospel, share His grace through loving our neighbors,

and work to end oppression.

EACH OF US HAVE OUR OWN UNIQUE STAMP THAT REVEALS HOW WE'RE

CREATED IN GOD'S IMAGE.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: [Jesus] went up on a mountainside by Himself to pray. Matthew 14:23
reflection: Jesus repeatedly help multitudes of people, yet He didn't allow Himself to become haggard and hurried. He nurtured His connection with God through prayer. How is it with you? Do you take time with God to experience His strength and fulfillment. WHEN WE DRAW NEAR TO GOD OUR MINDS ARE REFRESHED AND OUR STRENGTH IS RENEWED!
original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 30:

[Jesus] _went up on a mountainside by Himself to pray._

Mt. 14:23

Jesus repeatedly help multitudes of people, yet He didn't

allow Himself to become haggard and hurried. He

nurtured His connection with God through prayer. How

is it with you? Do you take time with God to experience

His strength and fulfillment.

WHEN WE DRAW NEAR TO GOD OUR MINDS ARE REFRESHED

AND OUR STRENGTH IS RENEWED!

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I tell you, now is the time of God's favor, now is the day of salvation. (2 Corinthians 6:2)
reflection: We need to keep this verse as a reminder; "Now is the day of salvation. " WHY? Have you asked Jesus into your heart? Do you have the assurance that you will have another day? Has the Holy Spirit alerted you to your need to put your trust in Jesus? Don't put it off! Run to Jesus. The Apostle Paul reminds us: "Now is the day!" REMEMBER THERE'S NO BETTER DAY THAN TODAY TO ENTER INTO GOD'S FAMILY! HAVE A HAPPY AND BLESSED NEW YEAR IN THE LORD'S FAVOR!
original_content:

_of salvation." WHY? _Have you asked Jesus into your heart?

Do you have the assurance that you will have another day?

Has the Holy Spirit alerted you to your need to put your

trust in Jesus? Don't put it off! Run to Jesus. The Apostle

Paul reminds us: _"Now is the day!"_

_REMEMBER THERE'S NO BETTER DAY THAN TODAY TO ENTER INTO_

_GOD'S FAMILY!_

_HAVE A HAPPY AND BLESSED NEW YEAR IN THE LORD'S FAVOR!_

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We who are still alive and are left will. meet the Lord in the air. And so we will be with the Lord forever. (I Thessalonians 4:17)
reflection: In an increasingly chaotic world, what a hopeful thought that this could be the year that Jesus returns. More comforting still is the anticipation that all who trust Him for salvation will be gathered together, relieved from this world's suffering, sorrow, and fear. Best of all, we'll be with the Lord forever. NEW YEAR'S RESOLUTION. SUGGESTION SHARE FAITH. OFFER PRAYER. GATHER HOPE.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 1:

_We who are still alive and are left will. meet the Lord in the _

_air. And so we will be with the Lord forever. _I Thess. 4:17

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In an increasingly chaotic world, what a hopeful thought that

this could be the year that Jesus returns. More comforting still

is the anticipation that all who trust Him for salvation will be

gathered together, relieved from this world's suffering, sorrow,

and fear. Best of all, we'll be with the Lord forever.

NEW YEAR'S RESOLUTION. SUGGESTION

SHARE FAITH. OFFER PRAYER. GATHER HOPE.

_PASTOR AL_
